qas.question: How can the ideal self be described in terms of the adolescent?

answers.text: who the adolescent wishes to be

qas.question: How can the feared self be described in terms of the adolescent?

answers.text: who the adolescent does not want to be

qas.question: Do adolescents demonstrate intended behavior moving towards the ideal or feared self?

context: Adolescents can conceptualize multiple "possible selves" that they could become and long-term possibilities and consequences of their choices. Exploring these possibilities may result in abrupt changes in self-presentation as the adolescent chooses or rejects qualities and behaviors, trying to guide the actual self toward the <a2_0>ideal<a2_0/> self (<a0_0>who the adolescent wishes to be<a0_0/>) and away from the feared self (<a1_0>who the adolescent does not want to be<a1_0/>). For many, these distinctions are uncomfortable, but they also appear to motivate achievement through behavior consistent with the ideal and distinct from the feared possible selves.
